items.title: Awesome Firebase Genkit
items.content_text:
### Articles / Dart - Official

*   [Extending Your AI Application with Genkit MCP](https://medium.com/@nozomi-koborinai/extending-your-ai-application-with-genkit-mcp-475d7533ca9e) - Learn how to integrate Google Maps using Genkit MCP client to query MCP servers for enhanced location-based AI features.
items.content_html:
Articles / Dart - Official

  • Extending Your AI Application with Genkit MCP - Learn how to integrate Google Maps using Genkit MCP client to query MCP servers for enhanced location-based AI features.

items.title: Awesome Polars
items.content_text:
### Polars plugins / Validation

*   [iban\_validation\_polars (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/ericqu/iban_validation/tree/main/iban_validation_polars) - A package to facilitate validation of IBANs and getting bank identifier and branch identifier as a Polars plugin by [@ericqu](https://github.com/ericqu).
*   [dataframely (‚≠ê355)](https://github.com/Quantco/dataframely) - Polars plugin that provides schema and other rule validation for Polars DataFrames by [@Quantco](https://github.com/Quantco).
items.content_html:
Polars plugins / Validation

  • iban_validation_polars (‚≠ê0) - A package to facilitate validation of IBANs and getting bank identifier and branch identifier as a Polars plugin by @ericqu.
  • dataframely (‚≠ê355) - Polars plugin that provides schema and other rule validation for Polars DataFrames by @Quantco.

items.title: Awesome Data Engineering
items.content_text:
### Charts and Dashboards

*   [Seaborn](https://seaborn.pydata.org) - A Python visualization library based on matplotlib. It provides a high-level interface for drawing attractive statistical graphics.
items.content_html:
Charts and Dashboards

  • Seaborn - A Python visualization library based on matplotlib. It provides a high-level interface for drawing attractive statistical graphics.

items.title: Awesome Deno
items.content_text:
### Modules / Web framework

*   [Yelix](https://docs.yelix.dev/) - Yelix is a [Hono (‚≠ê25k)](https://github.com/honojs/hono) based Deno web server framework that simplifies backend development with built-in tools and automation.
items.content_html:
Modules / Web framework

  • Yelix - Yelix is a Hono (‚≠ê25k) based Deno web server framework that simplifies backend development with built-in tools and automation.

items.title: Awesome Selfhosted
items.content_text:
### Software / Analytics

*   [Countly Community Edition](https://count.ly) - Real time mobile and web analytics, crash reporting and push notifications platform. ([Source Code (‚≠ê5.7k)](https://github.com/Countly/countly-server)) `AGPL-3.0` `Nodejs/Docker`

### Software / Archiving and Digital Preservation (DP)

*   [CKAN](https://ckan.org) - Make open data websites. ([Source Code (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/ckan/ckan)) `AGPL-3.0` `Python`

### Software / Automation

*   [changedetection.io](https://changedetection.io/) - Stay up-to-date with web-site content changes. ([Source Code (‚≠ê25k)](https://github.com/dgtlmoon/changedetection.io)) `Apache-2.0` `Python/Docker`

### Software / Blogging Platforms

*   [Castopod](https://castopod.org) - Podcast management hosting platform that includes the latest podcast 2.0 standards, an automated Fediverse feed, analytics, an embeddable player, and more. ([Source Code](https://code.castopod.org/adaures/castopod)) `AGPL-3.0` `PHP/Docker`

### Software / Booking and Scheduling

*   [Cal.com](https://cal.com/) - Online appointment scheduling system. ([Demo](https://app.cal.com/bailey), [Source Code (‚≠ê37k)](https://github.com/calcom/cal.com)) `AGPL-3.0` `Nodejs`

### Software / Communication - Custom Communication Systems

*   [Chitchatter](https://chitchatter.im/) - Peer-to-peer chat app that is serverless, decentralized, and ephemeral. ([Source Code (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/jeremyckahn/chitchatter)) `GPL-2.0` `Nodejs`

### Software / Communication - Social Networks and Forums

*   [Chirpy](https://chirpy.dev) - Privacy-friendly and customizable Disqus (comment system) alternate. ([Demo](https://chirpy.dev/play), [Source Code (‚≠ê585)](https://github.com/devrsi0n/chirpy)) `AGPL-3.0` `Docker/Nodejs`

### Software / Communication - XMPP - Web Clients

*   [Converse.js](https://conversejs.org/) - XMPP chat client in your browser. ([Source Code (‚≠ê3.1k)](https://github.com/conversejs/converse.js)) `MPL-2.0` `Javascript`

### Software / Content Management Systems (CMS)

*   [CMS Made Simple](https://www.cmsmadesimple.org/) - Faster and easier management of website contents, scalable for small businesses to large corporations. ([Source Code](http://svn.cmsmadesimple.org/svn/cmsmadesimple/trunk/)) `GPL-2.0` `PHP`
*   [Cockpit](https://getcockpit.com) - Simple content platform to manage any structured content. ([Source Code (‚≠ê470)](https://github.com/Cockpit-HQ/Cockpit)) `MIT` `PHP`
*   [Contao](https://contao.org/) - Powerful CMS that allows you to create professional websites and scalable web applications. ([Demo](https://demo.contao.org/contao), [Source Code (‚≠ê377)](https://github.com/contao/contao/)) `LGPL-3.0` `PHP`
*   [CouchCMS](https://www.couchcms.com/) - CMS for designers. ([Source Code (‚≠ê361)](https://github.com/CouchCMS/CouchCMS)) `CPAL-1.0` `PHP`

### Software / Customer Relationship Management (CRM)

*   [Corteza](https://docs.cortezaproject.org) - CRM including a unified workspace, enterprise messaging and a low code environment for rapidly and securely delivering records-based management solutions. ([Demo](https://latest.cortezaproject.org), [Source Code (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/cortezaproject/corteza)) `Apache-2.0` `Go`

### Software / Database Management

*   [Chartbrew](https://chartbrew.com) - Connect directly to databases and APIs and use the data to create beautiful charts. ([Demo](https://app.chartbrew.com/live-demo), [Source Code (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/chartbrew/chartbrew)) `MIT` `Nodejs/Docker`
*   [CloudBeaver](https://dbeaver.com/) - Manage databases, supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite and more. A web/hosted version of DBeaver. ([Source Code (‚≠ê4.1k)](https://github.com/dbeaver/cloudbeaver)) `Apache-2.0` `Docker`

### Software / Document Management - E-books

*   [Calibre Web (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/janeczku/calibre-web) - Browse, read and download eBooks using an existing Calibre database. `GPL-3.0` `Python`

### Software / E-commerce

*   [CoreShop](https://www.coreshop.org) - E-commerce plugin for Pimcore. ([Source Code (‚≠ê287)](https://github.com/coreshop/CoreShop)) `GPL-3.0` `PHP`

### Software / File Transfer - Single-click & Drag-n-drop Upload

*   [Slink](https://docs.slinkapp.io/) - Image sharing platform designed to give users complete control over their media sharing experience. ([Source Code (‚≠ê770)](https://github.com/andrii-kryvoviaz/slink)) `AGPL-3.0` `Docker`

### Software / Games - Administrative Utilities & Control Panels

*   [Crafty Controller](https://craftycontrol.com/) - Minecraft launcher and manager that allows users to start and administer Minecraft servers from a user-friendly interface. ([Source Code](https://gitlab.com/crafty-controller/crafty-4)) `GPL-3.0` `Docker/Python`

### Software / Generative Artificial Intelligence (GenAI)

*   [Ollama](https://ollama.com/) - Get up and running with Llama 3.3, DeepSeek-R1, Phi-4, Gemma 3, and other large language models. ([Source Code (‚≠ê146k)](https://github.com/ollama/ollama)) `MIT` `Docker/Python`
*   [Open-WebUI](https://openwebui.com) - User-friendly AI Interface, supports Ollama, OpenAI API. ([Source Code (‚≠ê102k)](https://github.com/open-webui/open-webui)) `BSD-3-Clause` `Docker/Python`
*   [Perplexica (‚≠ê23k)](https://github.com/ItzCrazyKns/Perplexica) - AI-powered search engine (alternative to Perplexity AI). `MIT` `Docker`

### Software / Learning and Courses

*   [Canvas LMS](https://www.instructure.com/canvas/) - Learning management system (LMS) that is revolutionizing the way we educate. ([Demo](https://canvas.instructure.com/register), [Source Code (‚≠ê6.1k)](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms)) `AGPL-3.0` `Ruby`
*   [Chamilo LMS](https://chamilo.org/) - Create a virtual campus for the provision of online or semi-online training. ([Source Code (‚≠ê869)](https://github.com/chamilo/chamilo-lms)) `GPL-3.0` `PHP`

### Software / Manufacturing

*   [CNCjs](https://cnc.js.org/) - Web interface for CNC milling controllers running Grbl, Smoothieware, or TinyG. ([Source Code (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/cncjs/cncjs/)) `MIT` `Nodejs`

### Software / Media Streaming - Video Streaming

*   [CyTube (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/calzoneman/sync) - Synchronize media, chat, and more for an arbitrary number of channels. ([Demo](https://cytu.be)) `MIT` `Nodejs`

### Software / Miscellaneous

*   [Cloudlog](https://magicbug.co.uk/cloudlog/) - Log your amateur radio contacts anywhere. ([Source Code (‚≠ê510)](https://github.com/magicbug/cloudlog)) `MIT` `PHP/Docker`
*   [MySpeed](https://myspeed.dev/) - Speed test analysis software that shows your internet speed for up to 30 days. ([Source Code (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/gnmyt/myspeed)) `MIT` `Docker/Nodejs`

### Software / Office Suites

*   [CryptPad](https://cryptpad.org) - Collaboration suite built to enable collaboration, synchronizing changes to documents in real time. ([Source Code (‚≠ê6.6k)](https://github.com/cryptpad/cryptpad)) `AGPL-3.0` `Nodejs/Docker`

### Software / Self-hosting Solutions

*   [CasaOS](https://casaos.zimaspace.com/) - Simple, easy-to-use, elegant Home Cloud system. ([Source Code (‚≠ê30k)](https://github.com/IceWhaleTech/CasaOS)) `Apache-2.0` `Go/Docker`

### Software / Software Development - Project Management

*   [Cgit](https://git.zx2c4.com/cgit/about/) - Fast lightweight web interface for git repositories. ([Source Code](https://git.zx2c4.com/cgit/tree/)) `GPL-2.0` `C`

### Software / Web Servers

*   [Zoraxy](https://zoraxy.aroz.org/) - General purpose HTTP reverse proxy and forwarding tool. ([Source Code (‚≠ê4.2k)](https://github.com/tobychui/zoraxy)) `AGPL-3.0` `Go/Docker`

items.title: Awesome Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### Tools / Misc

*   [Agentic Radar (‚≠ê623)](https://github.com/splx-ai/agentic-radar) -  Open-source CLI security scanner for agentic workflows. Scans your workflow‚Äôs source code, detects vulnerabilities, and generates an interactive visualization along with a detailed security report. Supports LangGraph, CrewAI, n8n, OpenAI Agents, and more.
items.content_html:
Tools / Misc

  • Agentic Radar (‚≠ê623) - Open-source CLI security scanner for agentic workflows. Scans your workflow‚Äôs source code, detects vulnerabilities, and generates an interactive visualization along with a detailed security report. Supports LangGraph, CrewAI, n8n, OpenAI Agents, and more.

items.title: Awesome Integration
items.content_text:
### Projects / API Design

*   [Spectral (‚≠ê2.7k) (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/stoplightio/spectral) - Detect and fix errors in your JSON/YAML files using this linter tool that supports OpenAPI 3.0 & 2.0 and AsyncAPI.

### Projects / API Documentation

*   [Stoplight Elements (‚≠ê2k) (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/stoplightio/elements) - Provides modular, attractive UI components for building comprehensive API reference and tutorial documentation.

### Projects / API Gateway

*   [Apache APISIX (‚≠ê15k) (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/apache/apisix) - A high-performance, dynamic gateway featuring real-time traffic management and powerful plugin integrations.

### Projects / Integration Frameworks

*   [Apache Camel (‚≠ê5.8k) (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/apache/camel) - Robust integration framework leveraging Enterprise Integration Patterns to seamlessly connect diverse systems and APIs.

### Resources / API Specification

*   [Standard Webhooks (‚≠ê1.4k) (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/standard-webhooks/standard-webhooks) - Open source tools and guidelines for sending webhooks easily, securely, and reliably.
items.content_html:

  • Spectral (‚≠ê2.7k) (‚≠ê2.8k) - Detect and fix errors in your JSON/YAML files using this linter tool that supports OpenAPI 3.0 & 2.0 and AsyncAPI.

Projects / API Documentation

  • Stoplight Elements (‚≠ê2k) (‚≠ê2.1k) - Provides modular, attractive UI components for building comprehensive API reference and tutorial documentation.

Projects / API Gateway

items.title: Awesome Osint
items.content_text:
### Speciality Search Engines

*   [Browserleaks](https://browserleaks.com/) - BrowserLeaks tests your browser for privacy and fingerprinting leaks

### Username Check / GitHub

*   [Cupidcr4wl (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/OSINTI4L/cupidcr4wl) - Username and phone number search tool that crawls adult content platforms to see if a targeted account or person is present.

### People Investigations / GitHub

*   [Apollo.io](https://www.apollo.io/) - Free B2B Phone Number & Email Finder. 1200 credits per user/year for free plan.
*   [ContactOut](https://contactout.com/) - Unlock the world's most accurate contact data. Find emails & phone for 300M professionals.

### Domain and IP Research / GitHub

*   [IP Geolocation API DB-IP](https://db-ip.com) - Pprovides IP geolocation and intelligence.

### Other Tools / GitHub

*   [Unfurl](https://dfir.blog/unfurl/) - Unfurl analyzes and breaks down URLs into useful forensic components for digital investigation.
items.content_html:
Speciality Search Engines

  • Browserleaks - BrowserLeaks tests your browser for privacy and fingerprinting leaks

Username Check / GitHub

  • Cupidcr4wl (‚≠ê23) - Username and phone number search tool that crawls adult content platforms to see if a targeted account or person is present.

People Investigations / GitHub

  • Apollo.io - Free B2B Phone Number & Email Finder. 1200 credits per user/year for free plan.
  • ContactOut - Unlock the world's most accurate contact data. Find emails & phone for 300M professionals.

Domain and IP Research / GitHub

  • IP Geolocation API DB-IP - Pprovides IP geolocation and intelligence.

Other Tools / GitHub

  • Unfurl - Unfurl analyzes and breaks down URLs into useful forensic components for digital investigation.

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### Bot Building

*   [telegram-bot-api (‚≠ê6.2k)](https://github.com/go-telegram-bot-api/telegram-bot-api) - Simple and clean Telegram bot client.

### Standard CLI

*   [go-readline-ny (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/nyaosorg/go-readline-ny) - A customizable line-editing library with Emacs keybindings, Unicode support, completion, and syntax highlighting. Used in NYAGOS shell.

### Databases Implemented in Go

*   [DiceDB (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/DiceDB/dice) - An open-source, fast, reactive, in-memory database optimized for modern hardware. Higher throughput and lower median latencies, making it ideal for modern workloads.

### Error Handling

*   [metaerr (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/quantumcycle/metaerr) - A library to create your custom error builders producing structured errors with metadata from different sources and optional stacktraces.
items.content_html:
Bot Building

  • telegram-bot-api (‚≠ê6.2k) - Simple and clean Telegram bot client.

Standard CLI

  • go-readline-ny (‚≠ê29) - A customizable line-editing library with Emacs keybindings, Unicode support, completion, and syntax highlighting. Used in NYAGOS shell.

Databases Implemented in Go

  • DiceDB (‚≠ê11k) - An open-source, fast, reactive, in-memory database optimized for modern hardware. Higher throughput and lower median latencies, making it ideal for modern workloads.

Error Handling

  • metaerr (‚≠ê4) - A library to create your custom error builders producing structured errors with metadata from different sources and optional stacktraces.

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### AI / Diagnostics

*   [GeorgesAlkhouri/nvim-aider (‚≠ê307)](https://github.com/GeorgesAlkhouri/nvim-aider) - Seamlessly integrate Aider for an AI-assisted coding experience.

### Programming Languages Support / Diagnostics

*   [kiyoon/haskell-scope-highlighting.nvim (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/kiyoon/haskell-scope-highlighting.nvim) - Haskell syntax highlighting that considers variable scopes. Inspired from "Context Coloring" by prof. Douglas Crockford.

### Golang / Diagnostics

*   [fredrikaverpil/godoc.nvim (‚≠ê158)](https://github.com/fredrikaverpil/godoc.nvim) - Fuzzy search Go packages/symbols and view docs.

### Language / Diagnostics

*   [doodleEsc/translator.nvim (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/doodleEsc/translator.nvim) - A powerful AI-powered translation plugin, leveraging OpenAI's GPT models to provide high-quality translations with natural language understanding.

### Tree-sitter Supported Colorscheme / Diagnostics

*   [ptdewey/monalisa-nvim (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/ptdewey/monalisa-nvim) - A dark and colorful Mona Lisa inspired colorscheme.

### Note Taking / Diagnostics

*   [y3owk1n/dotmd.nvim (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/y3owk1n/dotmd.nvim) - Managing notes, todos, journal entries and inbox all with markdown.
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Jamstack
items.content_text:
### API / Authentication

*   [Scalekit](https://scalekit.com) ‚Äì Add enterprise SSO (SAML, OIDC) and SCIM provisioning on top of existing auth systems like Auth0, Firebase, or Cognito without rewrites.
items.content_html:
API / Authentication

items.title: Free for Dev
items.content_text:
### Translation Management

*   [Lingo.dev](https://lingo.dev) ‚Äì Open-source AI-powered CLI for web & mobile localization. Bring your own LLM, or use 10,000 free words every month via Lingo.dev-managed localization engine.

### Low-code Platform

*   [appsmith](https://www.appsmith.com/) ‚Äî Low code project to build admin panels, internal tools, and dashboards. Integrates with 15+ databases and any API.
*   [Clappia](https://www.clappia.com) ‚Äî A low-code platform designed for building business process applications with customizable mobile and web apps. Offers a drag-and-drop interface, features like Offline Support, real-time location tracking and integration with various third-party services
*   [lil'bots](https://www.lilbots.io/) - write and run scripts online utilizing free built-in APIs like OpenAI, Anthropic, Firecrawl and others. Great for building AI agents / internal tooling and sharing with team. Free-tier includes full access to APIs, AI coding assistant and 10,000 execution credits / month.
*   [Mendix](https://www.mendix.com/) ‚Äî Rapid Application Development for Enterprises, unlimited accessible sandbox environments supporting total users, 0.5 GB storage and 1 GB RAM per app. Also, Studio and Studio Pro IDEs are allowed in the free tier.
*   [ReTool](https://retool.com/) ‚Äî Low-code platform for building internal applications. Retool is highly hackable. If you can write it with JavaScript and an API, you can make it in Retool. The free tier allows up to five users per month, unlimited apps and API connections.
*   [ToolJet](https://www.tooljet.com/) ‚Äî Extensible low-code framework for building business applications. Connect to databases, cloud storages, GraphQL, API endpoints, Airtable, etc., and build apps using drag-and-drop application builder.
*   [manubes](https://www.manubes.com) - Powerful no-code cloud platform with a focus on industrial production management. Free for one user with 1 million workflow activities a month ([also available in german](https://www.manubes.de)).
items.content_html:
Translation Management

  • Lingo.dev ‚Äì Open-source AI-powered CLI for web & mobile localization. Bring your own LLM, or use 10,000 free words every month via Lingo.dev-managed localization engine.

Low-code Platform

  • appsmith ‚Äî Low code project to build admin panels, internal tools, and dashboards. Integrates with 15+ databases and any API.
  • Clappia ‚Äî A low-code platform designed for building business process applications with customizable mobile and web apps. Offers a drag-and-drop interface, features like Offline Support, real-time location tracking and integration with various third-party services
  • lil'bots - write and run scripts online utilizing free built-in APIs like OpenAI, Anthropic, Firecrawl and others. Great for building AI agents / internal tooling and sharing with team. Free-tier includes full access to APIs, AI coding assistant and 10,000 execution credits / month.
  • Mendix ‚Äî Rapid Application Development for Enterprises, unlimited accessible sandbox environments supporting total users, 0.5 GB storage and 1 GB RAM per app. Also, Studio and Studio Pro IDEs are allowed in the free tier.
  • ReTool ‚Äî Low-code platform for building internal applications. Retool is highly hackable. If you can write it with JavaScript and an API, you can make it in Retool. The free tier allows up to five users per month, unlimited apps and API connections.
  • ToolJet ‚Äî Extensible low-code framework for building business applications. Connect to databases, cloud storages, GraphQL, API endpoints, Airtable, etc., and build apps using drag-and-drop application builder.
  • manubes - Powerful no-code cloud platform with a focus on industrial production management. Free for one user with 1 million workflow activities a month (also available in german).

items.title: Static Analysis
items.content_text:
### Programming Languages / [Other](#other-1)

*   [phploc (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phploc) ‚Äî A tool for quickly measuring the size and analyzing the structure of a PHP project.
*   [R Language Server (‚≠ê623)](https://github.com/REditorSupport/languageserver/) ‚Äî Provides code completion, refactoring, folding, diagnostics (with lintr), and more for R.
*   [cargo-geiger (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/geiger-rs/cargo-geiger) ‚Äî A cargo plugin for analysing the usage of unsafe Rust code Provides statistical output to aid security auditing
items.content_html:
Programming Languages / Other

  • phploc (‚≠ê2.3k) ‚Äî A tool for quickly measuring the size and analyzing the structure of a PHP project.
  • R Language Server (‚≠ê623) ‚Äî Provides code completion, refactoring, folding, diagnostics (with lintr), and more for R.
  • cargo-geiger (‚≠ê1.5k) ‚Äî A cargo plugin for analysing the usage of unsafe Rust code Provides statistical output to aid security auditing

items.title: Awesome Mac
items.content_text:
### Design and Product / Design Tools

*   [Lunacy](https://icons8.com/lunacy) - A vector graphic design tool for UI/UX with offline support, built-in assets, and real-time collaboration. ![Freeware](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-free.svg "Freeware") [![App Store](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-app-store.svg "App Store Software")](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/lunacy-graphic-design-editor/id1582493835?mt=12)

### Reading and Writing Tools / Text Editors

*   [MacVim (‚≠ê7.7k)](https://github.com/macvim-dev/macvim) - the text editor Vim - for macOS. [![Open-Source Software](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-oss.svg "Open Source Software")](https://github.com/macvim-dev/macvim) ![Freeware](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-free.svg "Freeware")

### Reading and Writing Tools / Others

*   [PDFsail](https://pdfsail.com/) - PDFsail offers free online PDF tools for editing, converting, merging, compressing, and OCR. No download required. Try this AI-powered all-in-one PDF solution now!.

### Audio and Video Tools / File Sharing

*   [MacMusicPlayer (‚≠ê45)](https://github.com/samzong/macmusicplayer) - A clean, lightweight music player for macOS users. ![Open-Source Software](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-oss.svg "Open Source Software") ![Freeware](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-free.svg "Freeware")

### Proxy and VPN Tools / Audio Record and Process

*   [Tailscale](https://tailscale.com/) - Tailscale makes creating software-defined networks easy: securely connecting users, services, and devices.

items.title: Awesome European Tech
items.content_text:
### Index / Cloud

*   [Gcore](https://gcore.com/) üá±üá∫ - Global cloud provider with bare-metal servers.
*   [OpenCloud](https://opencloud.eu/) üá©üá™ - Excellent file management and collaboration for anyone who values ease of use and digital sovereignty.

### Index / AI

*   [Hopsworks](https://hopsworks.ai) üá∏üá™ - AI Lakehouse and MLOps Platform. To Develop, Monitor and Maintain AI Systems.

### Index / CDN

*   [Gcore](https://gcore.com/cdn) üá±üá∫
*   [OVHcloud CDN](https://www.ovhcloud.com/en/web-hosting/options/cdn/) üá´üá∑

### Index / Cybersecurity

*   [OPNsense](https://opnsense.org/) üá≥üá± -  Firewall/router OS and (optionally) a custom computer to run on.

### Index / VPN

### Index / Web Analytics

items.title: Awesome Angular
items.content_text:
### Style Guides / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [Official Angular style guide](https://angular.dev/style-guide)

### Analytics / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular-google-tag-manager (‚≠ê145)](https://github.com/mzuccaroli/angular-google-tag-manager) - A service library for integrate google tag manager in your Angular project.
*   [ng-webdatarocks (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/WebDataRocks/ng-webdatarocks) - This repository contains the source code of the Angular wrapper for [WebDataRocks](https://www.webdatarocks.com/).  Follow this [example (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/WebDataRocks/pivot-angular) to integrate the WebDataRocks web reporting tool.

### Authentication / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [casl-angular (‚≠ê6.5k)](https://github.com/stalniy/casl/tree/master/packages/casl-angular) - Module which integrates isomorphic permissions management library [CASL (‚≠ê6.5k)](https://github.com/stalniy/casl) with Angular.
*   [@melody-auth/angular](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@melody-auth/angular) - [Melody Auth (‚≠ê425)](https://github.com/ValueMelody/melody-auth) Angular SDK facilitates seamless interaction between Angular applications and the melody auth server. It silently handles authentication state management, redirect flows, token exchange, and authentication validation for you.
*   [hexaeight-sessions](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hexaeight-sessions) - A powerful NPM library designed to simplify session management and authentication in web applications. Whether you're working with React, Angular, or Vue, [HexaEight Sessions](https://docs.hexaeight.com/HexaEight-Sessions/003-HexaEightSessions/) provides an intuitive interface for managing user sessions efficiently.
*   [frontegg-angular (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/frontegg/frontegg-angular) - [Frontegg](https://frontegg.com) is a web platform where SaaS companies can set up their fully managed, scalable, and brand-aware SaaS features and integrate them into their SaaS portals in up to 5 lines of code. Quickly integrate Frontegg‚Äôs login box with this [quickstart guide](https://developers.frontegg.com/sdks/frontend/angular/hosted-login).

### Feature Flags / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [featurit-sdk-angular (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/featurit/featurit-sdk-angular) - Angular wrapper of the Javascript client for the [FeaturIT](https://featurit.com/) Feature Flag management platform.

### HTTP / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [simply-direct (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/fvilli/simply-direct) - A fullstack communication library that bridges Angular and NestJS through real-time, bidirectional communication powered by WebSockets.
*   [ng-error-handling (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/ressurectit/ng-error-handling) - An Angular module designed for managing HTTP API error responses.
*   [active-connect (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/HiptJo/active-connect) - A powerful connection framework designed for smart web-based projects using Node.js, Angular, and WebSockets. It provides decorators and utilities to simplify the integration of Angular with a WebSocket server, making it easier to handle real-time communication between clients and the server.

### Integrations / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-react (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/ngeenx/ngx-react) - Embed React components or apps into Angular projects.
*   [@interopio/ng](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@interopio/ng) - This [IO Connect](https://interop.io/) Angular wrapper aims to facilitate Angular developers in initializing the IO Connect JavaScript libraries and using IO Connect functionalities in their projects.

### Internationalization / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ng-extract-i18n-merge (‚≠ê194)](https://github.com/daniel-sc/ng-extract-i18n-merge) - Extract and merge i18n xliff translation files for Angular projects.

### SEO / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [@unhead/angular](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@unhead/angular) - Full-stack `<head>` management for Angular applications.

### Calendars / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular-calendar (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/mattlewis92/angular-calendar) - A flexible calendar component for Angular 15+ that can display events on a month, week, or day view.

### Carousels / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-slider (‚≠ê399)](https://github.com/angular-slider/ngx-slider) - Self-contained, mobile friendly slider component for Angular based on [angularjs-slider (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/angular-slider/angularjs-slider).

### Charts / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-lightweight-charts (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/jamesbrobb/ngx-lightweight-charts) - An easily extendable Angular wrapper for [Trading View Lightweight Charts](https://www.tradingview.com/lightweight-charts/).

### Dates / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-date-fns (‚≠ê165)](https://github.com/joanllenas/ngx-date-fns) - [Date-fns](https://date-fns.org/) pipes for Angular.
*   [mat-datetimepicker (‚≠ê151)](https://github.com/kuhnroyal/mat-datetimepicker) - Material datetimepicker for `@angular/material`.

### DOM / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ng-dynamic-component (‚≠ê564)](https://github.com/gund/ng-dynamic-component) - Dynamic components with full life-cycle support for inputs and outputs for Angular.

### General / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [@paddls/ngx-form (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/paddls/ngx-form) - Model based typed reactive forms made easy.
*   [ngx-enhancy-forms (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/klippa-app/ngx-enhancy-forms) - Fancy enhanced Angular forms.
*   [@klubinskak/ngx-smart-forms (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/klubinskak/ngx-smart-forms) - Smart, Signal-powered form state utilities for Angular 17+.
*   [@pixelbyaj/ngx-form (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/pixelbyaj/ngx-form) - ISO20022 Angular Forms utilizing XSD and XML to facilitate the design of ISO20022 XSD in HTML forms. Additionally, these forms aid in structuring MX messages for HTML representation.

### Form Controls / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-emoji-mart-next (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/arturovt/ngx-emoji-mart-next) - Customizable Slack-like emoji picker.

### Validation / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-control-message (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/chawkitariq/ngx-control-message) - A library for binding a message to a synchronous or asynchronous form control validator.
*   [safari-numfix (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/algrith/safari-numfix) - A lightweight utility to safely handle paste and keydown events on number input fields in Safari.
*   [ngx-input-errors (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/aks1376/ngx-input-errors) - This project was developed for Angular Reactive Forms to automatically extract and display input validation error messages. This library supports multiple languages and allows for custom error messages for both standard form validations and user-defined validations.
*   [error-message (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/LuEsc/error-message) - A lightweight, flexible error handling library for Angular applications that provides standardized validation error display and management.

### Loaders / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-loading-page (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/dilipkumarsahoo/ngx-loading-page) - A sleek, adaptable loading page component featuring various loader styles, dynamic themes, customizable backgrounds, and a responsive card design built with Bootstrap.

### Maps / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ng-maps (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/ng-maps/ng-maps) - Modular map components for Angular.

### Markdown / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [mdbook-angular (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/bgotink/mdbook-angular) - A renderer for [mdbook](https://rust-lang.github.io/mdBook/index.html) that turns Angular code samples into running Angular applications.

### Additional / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-statewise (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/Pierre-MarieMarchio/ngx-statewise) - A state management solution for Angular applications, offering a lighter and easier-to-use alternative to libraries like NgRx or NGXS, while maintaining a clear and predictable architecture for managing your application's state.

### Tooltips / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [tooltip-testing (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/chandumaram/tooltip-testing) - Tooltip for Angular, forked from `cm-angular-tooltip`.

### Unspecified / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [Blueprint UI](https://blueprintui.dev/) - Accelerate your development with flexible UI components and tools that work everywhere.
*   [@jean-merelis/angular-components (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/jean-merelis/angular-components) - A library of reusable Angular components and utilities that provides high-quality UI elements for your applications.

### Material Based / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular-material-css-vars (‚≠ê195)](https://github.com/johannesjo/angular-material-css-vars) - Little library to use CSS variables with Angular Material.
*   [c3-components (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/c3ulnta0rk/c3-components) - An open-source component library that extends the `@angular/material` library.

### Viewers / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-json-treeview (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/MichaelDoyle/ngx-json-treeview) - A collapsible JSON tree view for Angular.

### Misc Components / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular-compiler-output (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/JeanMeche/angular-compiler-output) - See the JS output of the Angular compiler for a given Angular template.
*   [ngx-signal-hub](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ngx-signal-hub) - A lightweight, reactive signal hub service for Angular applications built using signals. It offers a hybrid approach, allowing both traditional callback-based subscriptions and efficient signal-based observation of the latest event state.

### RxJS / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-observable-lifecycle (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/cloudnc/ngx-observable-lifecycle) - Library for observing the lifecycle of an (Ivy compiled) Angular component.

### TypeScript / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-mf (‚≠ê45)](https://github.com/iamguid/ngx-mf) - Bind your model types to Angular FormGroup type.

### Inspired by Angular / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [arky-js](https://www.npmjs.com/package/arky-js) - A powerful, annotation-based framework for building serverless applications on AWS Lambda and API Gateway. Inspired by Angular and NestJS, Arky.js simplifies serverless development by providing decorators for defining modules, controllers, and services.
*   [di (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/kaokei/di) - This library is a lightweight dependency injection library, similar to [InversifyJS (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/inversify/InversifyJS) and [typedi (‚≠ê4.2k)](https://github.com/typestack/typedi).
*   [needle-di (‚≠ê71)](https://github.com/needle-di/needle-di) - A lightweight, type-safe Dependency Injection (DI) library for JavaScript and TypeScript projects.
items.content_html:
Style Guides / Google Developer Experts

  • Official Angular style guide

Analytics / Google Developer Experts

  • angular-google-tag-manager (‚≠ê145) - A service library for integrate google tag manager in your Angular project.
  • ng-webdatarocks (‚≠ê5) - This repository contains the source code of the Angular wrapper for WebDataRocks. Follow this example (‚≠ê30) to integrate the WebDataRocks web reporting tool.

Authentication / Google Developer Experts

  • casl-angular (‚≠ê6.5k) - Module which integrates isomorphic permissions management library CASL (‚≠ê6.5k) with Angular.
  • @melody-auth/angular - Melody Auth (‚≠ê425) Angular SDK facilitates seamless interaction between Angular applications and the melody auth server. It silently handles authentication state management, redirect flows, token exchange, and authentication validation for you.
  • hexaeight-sessions - A powerful NPM library designed to simplify session management and authentication in web applications. Whether you're working with React, Angular, or Vue, HexaEight Sessions provides an intuitive interface for managing user sessions efficiently.
  • frontegg-angular (‚≠ê7) - Frontegg is a web platform where SaaS companies can set up their fully managed, scalable, and brand-aware SaaS features and integrate them into their SaaS portals in up to 5 lines of code. Quickly integrate Frontegg‚Äôs login box with this quickstart guide.

Feature Flags / Google Developer Experts

  • featurit-sdk-angular (‚≠ê3) - Angular wrapper of the Javascript client for the FeaturIT Feature Flag management platform.

HTTP / Google Developer Experts

  • simply-direct (‚≠ê1) - A fullstack communication library that bridges Angular and NestJS through real-time, bidirectional communication powered by WebSockets.
  • ng-error-handling (‚≠ê2) - An Angular module designed for managing HTTP API error responses.
  • active-connect (‚≠ê2) - A powerful connection framework designed for smart web-based projects using Node.js, Angular, and WebSockets. It provides decorators and utilities to simplify the integration of Angular with a WebSocket server, making it easier to handle real-time communication between clients and the server.

Integrations / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-react (‚≠ê2) - Embed React components or apps into Angular projects.
  • @interopio/ng - This IO Connect Angular wrapper aims to facilitate Angular developers in initializing the IO Connect JavaScript libraries and using IO Connect functionalities in their projects.

Internationalization / Google Developer Experts

  • ng-extract-i18n-merge (‚≠ê194) - Extract and merge i18n xliff translation files for Angular projects.

SEO / Google Developer Experts

  • @unhead/angular - Full-stack <head> management for Angular applications.

Calendars / Google Developer Experts

  • angular-calendar (‚≠ê2.8k) - A flexible calendar component for Angular 15+ that can display events on a month, week, or day view.

Carousels / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-slider (‚≠ê399) - Self-contained, mobile friendly slider component for Angular based on angularjs-slider (‚≠ê1.2k).

Charts / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-lightweight-charts (‚≠ê4) - An easily extendable Angular wrapper for Trading View Lightweight Charts.

Dates / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-date-fns (‚≠ê165) - Date-fns pipes for Angular.
  • mat-datetimepicker (‚≠ê151) - Material datetimepicker for @angular/material.

DOM / Google Developer Experts

  • ng-dynamic-component (‚≠ê564) - Dynamic components with full life-cycle support for inputs and outputs for Angular.

General / Google Developer Experts

  • @paddls/ngx-form (‚≠ê14) - Model based typed reactive forms made easy.
  • ngx-enhancy-forms (‚≠ê4) - Fancy enhanced Angular forms.
  • @klubinskak/ngx-smart-forms (‚≠ê2) - Smart, Signal-powered form state utilities for Angular 17+.
  • @pixelbyaj/ngx-form (‚≠ê4) - ISO20022 Angular Forms utilizing XSD and XML to facilitate the design of ISO20022 XSD in HTML forms. Additionally, these forms aid in structuring MX messages for HTML representation.

Form Controls / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-emoji-mart-next (‚≠ê1) - Customizable Slack-like emoji picker.

Validation / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-control-message (‚≠ê3) - A library for binding a message to a synchronous or asynchronous form control validator.
  • safari-numfix (‚≠ê3) - A lightweight utility to safely handle paste and keydown events on number input fields in Safari.
  • ngx-input-errors (‚≠ê0) - This project was developed for Angular Reactive Forms to automatically extract and display input validation error messages. This library supports multiple languages and allows for custom error messages for both standard form validations and user-defined validations.
  • error-message (‚≠ê1) - A lightweight, flexible error handling library for Angular applications that provides standardized validation error display and management.

Loaders / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-loading-page (‚≠ê1) - A sleek, adaptable loading page component featuring various loader styles, dynamic themes, customizable backgrounds, and a responsive card design built with Bootstrap.

Maps / Google Developer Experts

  • ng-maps (‚≠ê48) - Modular map components for Angular.

Markdown / Google Developer Experts

  • mdbook-angular (‚≠ê3) - A renderer for mdbook that turns Angular code samples into running Angular applications.

Additional / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-statewise (‚≠ê2) - A state management solution for Angular applications, offering a lighter and easier-to-use alternative to libraries like NgRx or NGXS, while maintaining a clear and predictable architecture for managing your application's state.

Tooltips / Google Developer Experts

  • tooltip-testing (‚≠ê1) - Tooltip for Angular, forked from cm-angular-tooltip.

Unspecified / Google Developer Experts

  • Blueprint UI - Accelerate your development with flexible UI components and tools that work everywhere.
  • @jean-merelis/angular-components (‚≠ê1) - A library of reusable Angular components and utilities that provides high-quality UI elements for your applications.

Material Based / Google Developer Experts

  • angular-material-css-vars (‚≠ê195) - Little library to use CSS variables with Angular Material.
  • c3-components (‚≠ê1) - An open-source component library that extends the @angular/material library.

Viewers / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-json-treeview (‚≠ê6) - A collapsible JSON tree view for Angular.

Misc Components / Google Developer Experts

  • angular-compiler-output (‚≠ê20) - See the JS output of the Angular compiler for a given Angular template.
  • ngx-signal-hub - A lightweight, reactive signal hub service for Angular applications built using signals. It offers a hybrid approach, allowing both traditional callback-based subscriptions and efficient signal-based observation of the latest event state.

RxJS / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-observable-lifecycle (‚≠ê34) - Library for observing the lifecycle of an (Ivy compiled) Angular component.

TypeScript / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-mf (‚≠ê45) - Bind your model types to Angular FormGroup type.

Inspired by Angular / Google Developer Experts

  • arky-js - A powerful, annotation-based framework for building serverless applications on AWS Lambda and API Gateway. Inspired by Angular and NestJS, Arky.js simplifies serverless development by providing decorators for defining modules, controllers, and services.
  • di (‚≠ê2) - This library is a lightweight dependency injection library, similar to InversifyJS (‚≠ê12k) and typedi (‚≠ê4.2k).
  • needle-di (‚≠ê71) - A lightweight, type-safe Dependency Injection (DI) library for JavaScript and TypeScript projects.

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Abduction / Scientific Discovery

*   [When to trust the data: Further investigations of system error in a scientific reasoning task](https://link.springer.com/article/10.3758/BF03201090) - ***Memory & Cognition***, 1996. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=3131191372086488656)]. When evaluating experimental evidence, how do people deal with the possibility that some of the feedback is erroneous? The potential for error means that evidence evaluation must include decisions about when to ‚Äútrust the data.‚Äù This paper presents two studies that focus on subjects‚Äô responses to erroneous feedback in a hypothesis testing situation‚Äîa variant of Wason‚Äôs (1960) 2‚Äì4‚Äì6 rule discovery task in which some feedback was subject tosystem error: ‚Äúhits‚Äù were reported as ‚Äúmisses‚Äù and vice versa. Results show that, in contrast to previous research, people are equally adept at identifying false negatives and false positives; further, successful subjects were less likely to use a positive test strategy (Klayman & Ha, 1987) than were unsuccessful subjects. Finally, although others have found that generating possible hypotheses prior to experimentation increases success and task efficiency, such a manipulation did little to mitigate the effects of system error.

### Abduction / Applications in AI

*   [An Approach to Abductive Reasoning in Equational Logic](https://www.aaai.org/ocs/index.php/IJCAI/IJCAI13/paper/view/6624/6619) - ***IJCAI'13***, 2013. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=686895264429811190)]. Abduction has been extensively studied in propositional logic because of its many applications in artificial intelligence. However, its intrinsic complexity has been a limitation to the implementation of abductive reasoning tools in more expressive logics. The authors have devised such a tool in ground flat equational logic, in which literals are equations or disequations between constants. The tool is based on the computation of prime implicates. It uses a relaxed paramodulation calculus, designed to generate all prime implicates of a formula, together with a carefully defined data structure storing the implicates and able to efficiently detect, and remove, redundancies.
*   [Abduction-Based Explanations for Machine Learning Models](https://ojs.aaai.org//index.php/AAAI/article/view/3964) - ***AAAI'19***, 2019. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=7355960657107994022)]. The growing range of applications of Machine Learning (ML) in a multitude of settings motivates the ability of computing small explanations for predictions made. Small explanations are generally accepted as easier for human decision makers to understand. Most earlier work on computing explanations is based on heuristic approaches, providing no guarantees of quality, in terms of how close such solutions are from cardinality- or subset-minimal explanations. This paper develops a constraint-agnostic solution for computing explanations for any ML model. The proposed solution exploits abductive reasoning, and imposes the requirement that the ML model can be represented as sets of constraints using some target constraint reasoning system for which the decision problem can be answered with some oracle. The experimental results, obtained on well-known datasets, validate the scalability of the proposed approach as well as the quality of the computed solutions.
items.content_html:
Abduction / Scientific Discovery

  • When to trust the data: Further investigations of system error in a scientific reasoning task - Memory & Cognition, 1996. [All Versions]. When evaluating experimental evidence, how do people deal with the possibility that some of the feedback is erroneous? The potential for error means that evidence evaluation must include decisions about when to ‚Äútrust the data.‚Äù This paper presents two studies that focus on subjects‚Äô responses to erroneous feedback in a hypothesis testing situation‚Äîa variant of Wason‚Äôs (1960) 2‚Äì4‚Äì6 rule discovery task in which some feedback was subject tosystem error: ‚Äúhits‚Äù were reported as ‚Äúmisses‚Äù and vice versa. Results show that, in contrast to previous research, people are equally adept at identifying false negatives and false positives; further, successful subjects were less likely to use a positive test strategy (Klayman & Ha, 1987) than were unsuccessful subjects. Finally, although others have found that generating possible hypotheses prior to experimentation increases success and task efficiency, such a manipulation did little to mitigate the effects of system error.

Abduction / Applications in AI

  • An Approach to Abductive Reasoning in Equational Logic - IJCAI'13, 2013. [All Versions]. Abduction has been extensively studied in propositional logic because of its many applications in artificial intelligence. However, its intrinsic complexity has been a limitation to the implementation of abductive reasoning tools in more expressive logics. The authors have devised such a tool in ground flat equational logic, in which literals are equations or disequations between constants. The tool is based on the computation of prime implicates. It uses a relaxed paramodulation calculus, designed to generate all prime implicates of a formula, together with a carefully defined data structure storing the implicates and able to efficiently detect, and remove, redundancies.
  • Abduction-Based Explanations for Machine Learning Models - AAAI'19, 2019. [All Versions]. The growing range of applications of Machine Learning (ML) in a multitude of settings motivates the ability of computing small explanations for predictions made. Small explanations are generally accepted as easier for human decision makers to understand. Most earlier work on computing explanations is based on heuristic approaches, providing no guarantees of quality, in terms of how close such solutions are from cardinality- or subset-minimal explanations. This paper develops a constraint-agnostic solution for computing explanations for any ML model. The proposed solution exploits abductive reasoning, and imposes the requirement that the ML model can be represented as sets of constraints using some target constraint reasoning system for which the decision problem can be answered with some oracle. The experimental results, obtained on well-known datasets, validate the scalability of the proposed approach as well as the quality of the computed solutions.
